website_summaries.verdict: Solid scientific calculator offers plentiful functions at a reasonable price. Great for students or professionals.
pros: Has 280 functions, including fractions, stats, and other calculations
Multi-replay lets you backtrack and edit expressions
cons: Buttons may come loose at times
Battery life is short despite solar power backup

customer_reviews.title: Useful for engineering students taking the FE
customer_reviews.text: I am a mechanical engineering student and am required to use an FE-approved calculator for all my classes. I love this one for the matrix functionality (great for linear interpolation!), quick decimal-to-fraction conversion, and scientific, engineering, and decimal display modes. I wish it had a graphing function, but since that's not allowed on the FE exam, I'm pretty happy with this calculator. I recommend watching YouTube videos about it to learn all the cool tricks you can use to get more out of it. As my thermodynamics professor exclaimed when describing this calculator, "all the math you can do for only about $17!"
customer_reviews.author: collegerepeat

customer_reviews.title: Engineering majors say yaaaassss
customer_reviews.text: I go to college for Engineering, and I can only use this specific calculator in my classes. This calculator is affordable priced, and performs every function that a reasonable, educated person should need to perform given that they are able to solve more complex functions by hand. If you are looking for a calculator capable of solving complex functions and systems of equations, this will not do that. However, if you are looking for a great mid tier calculator, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ClemsonTiger

customer_reviews.title: Great for Algebra/Calculus
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite scientific calculator. I have used many of the TI-30xxx calculators. They are all terrible time wasters in math. This calculator allows you to type in your calculations naturally, as they appear on paper. That is, fractions, exponents, square roots, etc. all appear properly and not compacted onto a single line. You can do any base log. And the vast amount of available functions makes this the best calculator for any class that requires a scientific calculator. Take time to learn all of the functions, read the manual, and this Casio will take you far.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for working statistics problems
customer_reviews.text: I am using this calculator as I go through "The Humongous Book Of Statistics Problems". I find it remarkably helpful to be able to enter an entire calculation and inspect each of the values & operators before executing it. It displays both ratio's and decimal easily. It calculates probabilities easily as well - you just shift between "comp" mode and "stat" mode. And it is very inexpensive IMO. I suppose you could use a laptop or iPad but this little thing is handy. It does lots of other things that I have not looked at - but stat students will like it I think.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy G. Mccoy

customer_reviews.title: It has all the important functione
customer_reviews.text: It has a lot of great functons such as logarithms with selectable bases nPr, nCr, fctorials d/dx. Its comfortabe and has a nice case. If you're working with math or helpng someone, its a good tool. If you get familiar with it and misplace it, its less than $20 Matrices and vectors. About all it doesn't have is graphing and programmability. For High School or College it just what's needed I prefer the silver ones to easily read the second and third functions listed above the keys. Math is fun if you have a nice calculator-
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these calculators they work great. one of my calculators overheated & got deformed like a banana some how & the back of the calculator has a bulge poping up the plastic it wasn’t exposed to heat @ all... it’s just s bad apple...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a Good Calculator and Allowed for Most College Tests
customer_reviews.text: As always, the quality of Casio can't be beaten. This is the required college algebra calculator. It is allowed in class, on quizzes and tests. It does the quadratic equations. Must have for college students. Love it. Don't get it at the school bookstore, the cost is double. Get it from Amazon dealer instead. Don't forget to keep the receipt for a tax write off for business or as a student.
customer_reviews.author: Enjoyable. Great graphics.

customer_reviews.title: Great for engineering
customer_reviews.text: I use it for engineering classes and it honestly has more features than I will ever need. Not sure why students spends hundreds on the TI ones. If I really want to graph something I’ll use the grapher app on my MacBook. Or even the google calculator which I can do on my phone. And I solve everything else on Matlab, which is a more useful skill to have.
customer_reviews.author: mash

customer_reviews.title: Professor Reccomended!
customer_reviews.text: Reccomended for Tech. Math in college. This scientific call is awesome and perfect! Easy to use and understand. The way the equations are displayed make it easy to read to ensure the correct information was entered. Buttons are labeled clearly. I also like how the design is simple and not with fancy designs. I’ve seen another Casio with cool black design, but students find the design distracting when trying to use “shift” symbols. Love it, you should get it if you’re taking any class requiring a SCIENTIFIC calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS! I have used a TI-84+ since Highschool ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS! I have used a TI-84+ since Highschool (forever ago) and couldn't use it to take my FE exam. So I purchased this to take the test. Well this calculator is so much cheaper than my 84 and does SO MUCH MORE! I use this every day at work and don't even touch the $100 TI-84 anymore. The functions are amazing, but a little confusing at first. It can do anything you want except graph. Seriously recommend if you're taking professional exams, PE, FE ACT, SAT, anything that lists this as an option USE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price tag and one if the best calcs I've used!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this type of calculator throughout my time in high school and I did all of my lower division courses for EE with it as well before making the switch to the ti-89 (I know, I should have gone for the ti-inspire). It's a solid calculator that is worth learning how to use and can do a lot more than what you'd think it can do. Although, you're better off getting the ti-inspire CAS from the start if you're going into EE. It's just waaay more powerful than this calc. Although, I still keep my casio in case a professor won't let me use my ti-89 on the exam.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: So Good someone Stole It
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is so good that a girl in my chemistry lab stole mine, and I had to but another. I guess it's pretty good because I came back and bought the same one. The display is large and easy to read and the buttons are all very comprehensive. It has simple controls and is great to learn on, this calculator gets the job done for all my math and chemistry classes. There are some function on the calculator that took my quite a while to learn and some quick short cuts, overall a pretty good calculator for the money.
customer_reviews.author: T Janette Holdahl

customer_reviews.title: Really odd calculator
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 for school and it kept giving her the wrong answer. I had to read the instructions a few times to realize she had to press additional button she needed based on formatting needs. I never had a calculator this complicated for a student to use. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nati

customer_reviews.title: I love this calculator, I hope Casio never stops making it.
customer_reviews.text: I understand that this is "just a calculator" but if you're taking a Gen Chem course then this is absolutely, hands down the best calculator for your money. It has the "x10^n" (big time saver for those Avogadro number calcs), it has the edit equation feature (time saver) the ANS copy button (another time saver)....and the list goes on. Its <$20 and it's a freakin BOSS calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator for PE exam
customer_reviews.text: This is the best calculator certified for the PE exam. I had the older fs-115ES (non-Plus) and raced it compared to this newer Plus version. This Plus version is a few seconds faster in some of the longer solve calculations. Where the Plus version really shines is the additional settings. It's not that expensive, go with this version over the non-Plus. It'll blow you away with how much you can do compared to a graphing calculator (e.g, TI-89 titanium). It seemingly does 95% of what those can do in a cheaper and sleeker package. The best strategy is to use this in school so you get used to it while preparing for future professional exams.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing calculator for the price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had to get this calculator as it had calculus functions without being a graphing calculator. I am a math teacher and teach one-on-one. My students have all come to love this calculator and prefer it to their TIs for most uses, great for SAT/ACT testing. The natural display in fraction and radical form is very useful. The only other calculators that I have loved as much are the HP with the super useful RPN input.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Scientific Calculator Out There
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking Intermediate College Algebra and we weren't allowed to use graphing calculators so I ordered this one. This calculator is so worth the money. It's a little difficult to figure out, but once you get the hand of it, it's easy. I love how it simplifies everything for you and you don't have to convert anything from the stupid decimal form. For example if you put in a radical it can simplify it for you in radical form instead of it popping up as a decimal. This is a wonderful scientific calculator if you aren't allowed to use a graphing calculator. Gives you answers in the form you want it and makes everything super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Suri

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is a life saver. I wouldn’t have gotten through calculus if this thing didn’t have the features it has on it. I wasn’t permitted to use anything but a scientific calculator on exams, but this one seemed to have more than your average scientific calculator does and it’s very simple to use. I recommended this calculator to my friends and several of them ended up getting one and they all loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: PE Control Systems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the PE Control Systems exam. I also bought the TI-36X Pro as you are allowed to bring more than one calculator, and having a backup is a good idea. I The TI-36X Pro is better, and I only used it during the exam. I found that the operations and functions that I needed to use were simply better, easier and faster on the TI-36X Pro. The Casio Fx-115ES is fine and there is nothing wrong with it. Its just not as good for my use as the TI.
customer_reviews.author: Free88Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this calculator daily in college and I really like it. At first I did not know how to use it properly, but after I read a little bit of the manual, everything was fine. Maybe the only thing that is a little bothersome are the buttons, but in my case they do not fall off they just move in the same place. However, is just as they said, one can type the problem like it appears in a text book, which is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sexy science censored
customer_reviews.text: GORGEOUS! Casio, you guys contrive to (and succeed!) make the science sexy. THAT matte shine of white paint, sexy CLICK of buttons and closing cover, beautiful screen sharpness and NO weight compared to FULL list of math, stats and other functions. I became your loyal user in 2011 when I was admitted to Nazarbayev University - we were given a fx-85 each for the period of studying. So when I graduated and had to return it, I felt like I lost my clothes - I became bare naked in the whole world of post-undergrad calculations :D
customer_reviews.author: Mergen Alimaganbetov

customer_reviews.title: #1 Scientific Calculator for Basic Use
customer_reviews.text: The best calculator for the functions and price. It has all of the functions needed for most math and science classes. I love the fraction to decimal function and storing function. The display is very simple and clean, you can apply complex/long equations easily like how you would write it on paper. As a chemistry major, this calculator makes conversions extremely easy to calculate. I have lost this calculator 3 times (mostly likely stolen each time) and tried other calculators but none can compare. I will always repurchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this type of calculator since middle school. Recently I lost my old calculator so I had to buy a new one. This one is perfect and works like charm. As an economics and math double major, this one does everything I need in every classes of mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BIG Help!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent calculator, as it came recommended by my professor. I have been using it for about 2 weeks for my math course this semester; and this baby has already saved my behind on homework and a quiz!! Just make sure you have someone who can show you how to use the different functions easily, so you do not have to study the manual. ;) Overall, this is a great investment and aid for my studies, at a good price, and got to me quickly. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: GidgetteGZ

customer_reviews.title: Survey portion of the PE
customer_reviews.text: Very simply, this product is far better and far cheaper than the equivalent TI product for the the Survey test to become a professional Civil Engineer in the state of california. Converting from Degrees minutes seconds is trivial on this product whereas it is cumbersome on TI. By using this product, you are essentially giving yourself time on the exam as you won't have to go through the tedium of TI's conversion. This is coming from someone who has used TI all his life. For 20 bucks it's a worth while investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Best Scientific Calculator I Have Used
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these calculators for about 8 years, and I have never had to replace the battery. It is dependable and provides functionality that other scientific calculators lack. The user interface is intuitive and simple, and I love how it displays fractions and square roots easily for the user. The functionalities of such a cheap, low-power calculator is quite impressive. The constants and conversions help a lot in physics and chemistry. To be honest, this calculator rivals many graphing calculators due to its simplicity and price. It provides integration/derivative functionality along with equation solvers that just scratch the surface of what this calculator can do.
customer_reviews.author: Alan P

customer_reviews.title: Light and fast and helpful
customer_reviews.text: Make me remember my old school day's. I used 10+ years back but after opening the box I got the same feeling. Function are pretty much same and didn't take much time for me to use all the function. Speed improve from old version and light too. I love it For first time user please refer instructions document. All explained very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mritunjay

customer_reviews.title: Great features for the price, we bought 2
customer_reviews.text: We got one for our daughter in middle school and liked it so much we got one for ourselves as well. It has held up well, and with a little investment in time to learn there features, it handles complex problems with fairly easy input and clear display of the output. If there’s one major thing to know about this unit, you have to get used to switching between decimal and fraction modes.
customer_reviews.author: Photographer, Mac user

customer_reviews.title: Extremely complicated
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is extremely complicated to use. I have watched multiple videos and read the user manual. I have also checked out their online forum. The screen is hard to read on the equation function and hard to understand. 10/10 would not purchase unless you have hours upon hours to learn every function on this.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: The display is nice and shows equations
customer_reviews.text: It's a scientific calculator. The display is nice and shows equations. There are alot of options for how to display results, decimal vs fraction vs improper fraction vs radians and so on. It is a bit confusing to use at first as it does not always work the same way that my older Casio did, but I am getting used to it. I would have prefered a calculator that worked more like my older one, but this one does make it easier to enter formulas. The hard cover is nice and keeps the calculator protected. The picture is a bit deceiving, the calculator is narrow than the picture makes it appear.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mefford

customer_reviews.title: Big learning curve
customer_reviews.text: Coming from the more complex FXCG10 I believed this calculator would be a breeze to learn but there were several things that took some time getting used to. It gets 3 stars because it can do quite a bit for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Shahla Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Casio, this is the calculator that got me through Math 70 and Math 102. It does everything from fractions to Logs and better still it is totally legal to use (my college has a strict "No Graphing Calculators" policy.) It is really easy to use, I never had to look at the manual. Everything is color coded and a little experimentation will give you all you need! Thank you Mr. Shahla for recommending such a great calculator!
customer_reviews.author: Crys

customer_reviews.title: Best scientific calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is great for college level engineering. The speed that you can perform a variety of common calculations is astounding. This product is lightweight and the buttons make for a quicker and smoother experience. Anyone using a texas instrument calculator need to try one of these out for a week. This is a must have for anyone trying to take a PE (professional Engineer) exam.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Seeking

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is a good calculator for school works, easy to use with a lot of functions. It’s also SUPER lightweight which even makes me feel uncomfortable holding it. BUT I just received it yesterday, used it for less than 30 mins and realized the ON button is stuck down (my first picture). That button still works but I’m REALLY upset about this. I bought a new calculator and have been using it for less than 30 mins and it’s already broken??? I take a look at the second picture which I took when I just opened it and it seems like that button was stuck from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Ly Ly xuan

customer_reviews.title: I'm a convert.  Easiest to use!
customer_reviews.text: I really love the layout of this calculator. The functions are so easy to use. I have switched from TI models to these Casio's. Having the answer key right next to the equal sign is perfect, because you don't have to shift to type in your previous answer. I also love that you can enter log with any base you want. The mixed number key makes life easier, too. The conversion key from fraction to decimal is terrific, as is the natural display. I have dabbled in solving equations, and I know there are a lot more functions I haven't explored. It's an excellent calculator that I give as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Best scientific calculator in the game
customer_reviews.text: I’m a chem major at UCSB and I love this calculator. I used it from Trig to differential equations+Calc multi variable and all 3 semesters of physics. Highly recommend to anyone in highschool or college for its basic integration ability and the ability to use matrices up to 3x3 and it has a bunch of preset characters for long complex numbers
customer_reviews.author: Roya Eskandar

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had this one in middle/high school
customer_reviews.text: Got this calculator my senior year of my engineering degree. I've been using Casio my entire life and I'm very happy with the features it provides. It's basically a graphing calculator without the graphs. My old one died after 8 years of use, and I got this one because they don't make the other anymore, this one has more features, and is allowed on the Fundamentals of Engineering exam.
customer_reviews.author: Mel N

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Our HS doesn’t give out a list ahead of time. They go to school and each teacher tells you what you need. It’s annoying but luckily I got this much cheaper than going to stupid Walmart and fast given the format our school does things. 16 y/o has been pleased with it and will use it throughout his HS career.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like that it is different than the Texas Instrument calculators
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is different than the Texas Instrument calculators, and it exceeded me expectations, would use this calculator for my math classes, like Precalculus and Trigonometry and Science classes! Just it may take a while to get used to, if you used to Texas Instruments, that what it felt for me!
customer_reviews.author: Mateen

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best calculator by far I've ever had. I use it more than my expensive Texas Instrument calculator. If you're in high school or University, this calculator will make like easier as you can literally type in the problems as they're written on paper unlike the TIs where you have to divide the problems in pieces in order to solve without mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: El J

customer_reviews.title: Good calculator, iffy construction.
customer_reviews.text: I love this calculator due to it's ability to input and output "real" answers For example, the inverse sin of 1 would output "pi / 2". The build quality is a bit lower than I would have hoped for. The keys have some give to them, you can jiggle them around their hole. Although it hasn't become an issue when inputting calculations, it still makes it feel a little cheap. All in all, this is a great scientific calculator. I would recommend getting this one or the TI-36X for any classes that prohibit graphing calculators.
customer_reviews.author: diegoz281

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend in these difficult math courses
customer_reviews.text: When my college professor said to leave fractions on the calculator but the other ones don't give you a fraction, this little buddy has your back and gives you the fractions. I prefer this calculator to the Texas one. My professor recommended the class to get it and I swear, I am so hook on this calculator that I do not want to use any other calculator out there ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice calculator. I love the solar power with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice calculator. I love the solar power with the battery backup, as you can use it in light or dark, and it extends battery life. The calculus functions make life so much easier and since it is a scientific calculator, it is allowed on most college math exams where graphing calculators are not. Tons of features and constants built in to it. Makes chemistry and statistics calculations much faster. Although one drawback is that the negative sign is in an awkward place above the numbers, and pressing it is really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Y

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream.
customer_reviews.text: Greadcalculator with so many functions so useful in my business major, in statistics, accounting and economics classes. Doesnt help much with choir though. But it does calculate and simplify time. Way to go japan. You did better then america. However Texas instruments wil still be on top in america cause that is what all the schools reccomend, because the textbooks reccomend them.... Why??? Cause texas instuments is a sponser. Forget what your teachers say, get this one and look up how to use all its features, this is incredibly powerful for a scientific calculator
customer_reviews.author: バカ人

customer_reviews.title: Best for trig
customer_reviews.text: I had this calculator gifted to me quite a while back but I somehow lost in the move from home to college. Because of all the fractions required in my trigonometry class, this calculator has helped me not even try. It will keep fractions in fraction form unless you hit the S->D button and it just is all together easier to use. I would suggest this to anyone going into any sort of trig or geometry class.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Elise

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality and user-friendliness
customer_reviews.text: I have used Casio products for over 15 years. Using this calculator literally looks and feels as though you're using a high-end programmable calculator with tons of applications: calculus, statistics, matrices, and so much more. What tops it off is that its operation is very intuitive and user-friendly. Once you buy this calculator, there's no going back to any other brand. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Vishal

customer_reviews.title: Great, but only for Casio kids
customer_reviews.text: I have used a TI-83/84 for all math in the past six years but for the FE exam I bought this Casio based on many recommendations. If you are NOT a Casio kid used to using Casios and you are a TI baby like me, skip this thing and go get the 36X pro for the FE exam. I'm sure that the CASIO is a great calculator, but if using a TI is second nature to you just stick with TI.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Wells

customer_reviews.title: Solid calculator, great for surveying.
customer_reviews.text: Great for surveying use by a civil engineering student. Does degrees, minutes, seconds much faster and easier than my normal TI 36x pro. Still prefer the TI, but if you're going to be doing survey work the TI is very clunky taking about two menus and three button presses to do what the Casio does with one press. Cheap enough to get both of you're trying to decide. I would recommend. Both are cleared for the FE as of this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome calculator! Aced my exam!
customer_reviews.text: This calculator rocks! I had a TI at first and it would not handle complex numbers or complete even half of the functions these baby handles. This does prime factorization, system of equations, quadratic equations, and logarithmic functions brilliantly. I passed my College Algebra exam with a near - perfect score. Lastly, I noticed comments about it nit handling order of operations well. It does you just must be mindful of parentheses and you may have to place a parenthesis within a parenthesis.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Great and fully capable
customer_reviews.text: Great and fully capable! It took me, yes I read the instructions, 6 hours to learn the basics like doing: 9/18= and seeing 1/2! I found out that using the SD button shifts back and forth from fraction (native) to Decimal! This is a great calculator for the wood shop to do work with Metric/SAE, Fractions/Decimals! It isn't solar powered but solar supplemented to prolong battery life! It won't work on the solar part without the battery. They say to replace the battery every 3 years!
customer_reviews.author: MACONGA1371

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful for Engineering
customer_reviews.text: I am a mechanical engineering student and recently I have needed a device that will calculate complex and imaginary numbers. I have a TI-84 plus but the problem-solving software is not on this version. The Casio fx-115ES Plus has the capability to calculate everything that is required for circuits and is much cheaper than the TI-89 and Inspire calculators. This calculator is also allowed on the FE exam because it is non-programmable.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Draper

customer_reviews.title: Casio is such a reliable brand
customer_reviews.text: I had a fx-570MS for over 15 years, still working great, no issue at all. Now buying a 115ES, just because it is allowed to take into the exam that I am going to take soon. This natural display calculator is certainly even better than 115ES. Give me power to pass the exam!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great for College Chemistry
customer_reviews.text: Great for Chemistry 51 and 60. Good calculator for basic calculations, conversions/kilojoules, fractions, scientific calculations. I hate how I enter a basic function and it gives me a fraction but no problem. I just simply it on paper or on my phone. It gets the job done and it’s bigger than it looks.
customer_reviews.author: PrettyFitCurvy

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: This device is well equipped for college/ university students. I would recommend using the youtube video to learn all the functions of this calculator. You cant figure it out on your own. It needs the practice to be useful to you. Good Price. Good device. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not scientific like the description says.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my finance class and it turns out it is not scientific and can not calculate future values. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was needed
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed a scientific calculator for her high school work. Bought this from the warehouse and saved a few bucks. Works exactly as it is supposed to, user friendly and provides all the functions needed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Lubitz

customer_reviews.title: 20 years and still going
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Casio with solar that is still going Strong after 20 years. Thought I'd buy a new version since the price was great. However hate the minuscule operations book. The old Casio had a descent size book that accompanied it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathine Goldenthal

customer_reviews.title: I love this calculator
customer_reviews.text: I love this calculator! I left it in Germany and bought exactly the same! The constants saved in it are pretty easy to find and as a whole it is super easy to use! I'm a senior physics student and I don't need anything more, this is more than fine. The only negative aspect is that you cannot write too long equations cause it won't allow you to do so, but if you split them you can save up to 6 partial results that will be saved even if you turn the calculator off!
customer_reviews.author: Oskar Pfeffer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Professional Exams
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Casio specifically for taking an amateur radio exam that required complex number operations. Although I'm normally an HP RPN guy, the reviews and price of the HP35s convinced me to go with the Casio and I'm glad I did. RPN is much less important when the calculator uses formula entry like this Casio. Also the Casio is easy to completely reset as required before use on an exam, and the monitors verify that you have cleared the calculator. So I passed my exam and love the Casio.
customer_reviews.author: Super Max

customer_reviews.title: This Casio has everything.
customer_reviews.text: Great calculator, which is main reason I bought it, good price. But also has very sophisticated math, scientific, and engineering capabilities if/when I need any of those. Built in solar recharge eliminates battery changes. Keys are clearly marked, and complicated functions well explained in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Casio, better for the best price.
customer_reviews.text: There isn't very much to say in terms of criticizing it, especially for the price point. It performs well for me under a variety of tasks I use it for, especially school work. The little guy has even saved me points on a test with its equation functions. The saved points alone were worth the price. If your school allows you to have a choice in calculators, ditch the expensive ones and stick with the Casio line.
customer_reviews.author: The Studenterino

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Texas Instruments equivalent, it's worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: Buy the Texas Instruments equivalent. I got this first because it was cheaper, it wasnt intuitively designed. Ended up buying the TI anyway so this was a waste
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but feels flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad calculator for the money, but it feels a little flimsy. The Texas Instruments I have seems better built. Still, it is easy to use and has a lot of good features. Good for high school or college students.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model for 10+ years. It works well for my purposes. Battery just seems to work for forever that I forget its battery operated. I wish the screen could be bigger and brighter. It’s not the best out there but it’s okay.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A very good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my daughter who is doing A-levels and will also write SAT 2 examination. She was using the Fx 991es plus, and told me that the fx 115es plus is wide miles apart from the fx 991 es plus. She said it does LCM, HCF, vectors, solves quadratic equations easily and simple to operate and understand. Had to order it from Amazon and delivered to Port Harcourt Nigeria.
customer_reviews.author: Okey Ezealah

customer_reviews.title: Most important and suitable calculator for engineering students
customer_reviews.text: In my embedded system class I need convert hexadecimal number to decimal number very often. This calculator is easy and convenient for doing this. And this calculator is not so expensive because it has no unnecessary function, like color screen, access to the internet. Highly recommend for engineering students.
customer_reviews.author: Qiang Fu

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this calculator. I purchased it somewhere else the first time. It got me through my SAT's, college algebra 1 & 2 and a few other classes but I wore out my buttons. I couldn't read them anymore. So I purchased it from this seller. I got my order quick and the calculator came with all the things mentioned, brand new, sealed and awesome. The price was good as well. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Caramelsun

customer_reviews.title: I think this is much better than Ti-84
customer_reviews.text: I think this is much better than Ti-84, I'm serious because I started using this calculator long time ago. I brought it again because I lost my last one. But some functions such as equation and calculus, I'm still confused about it. This is why I give it 4 star. But that is really really good product.
customer_reviews.author: TeAmo

customer_reviews.title: Manual might as well be written in Chinese
customer_reviews.text: Tiny font. No ID of each key. Calculator is useful. User's manual is almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: HLB Engineering

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Calculator...especially for Math/Engineering majors
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior completing my Civil Engineering degree. I have gone through my share of large and expensive calculators that do the job but lack in certain ares. It took me all of two days to decide that this Casio calc was my new favorite. I still carry my expensive calculators but only as a backup. For the price, this calculator is a steal and will become one of your most used tools in school, as well as, in your profession.
customer_reviews.author: Big Onti

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator for math PhD qualifying exams
customer_reviews.text: Most people use this calculator for high school math classes before calculus, I happen to use it for my math PhD qualifying exams, since no graphing calculators were allowed. This turns out to be the best option one can have, with all capabilities aside from making pretty plots. I found the Distribution mode (calculates Guassian pdf/cdf, binomial pmf), numerical integration, solving systems of linear equations particularly useful. The only thing that I wish could be better is capability to invert matrices of size 4x4 or higher, but that's infrequently used any way in an exam. I recommended the calculator to all my doctoral program classmates, and everyone loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Best Calculator you can get for Engineering
customer_reviews.text: This is the best and most useful calculator you can get for the FE exam. It lets you do almost the entire math section (matrices, integrals, derivatives, etc) and some of the probability and statistics section also. The buttons are really easy to push and feel great in your hand. I don't accidentally push the wrong keys like I do on my TI-36X Solar. The screen is huge. I love that you can scroll back up through previous answers. I love that the previous answer is a button you can press for your next equation. This will be a huge time saver for the exam! Well worth the very low price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: The buttons are atrocious
customer_reviews.text: Mediocre build quality, but is what is expected from the price. Functions well, but time will tell. Buttons are so bad. Then again my favorite calculator is the HP 15c... so how could I ever be fully satisfied with this. I like the solar panel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Next time I'll just buy it in person.
customer_reviews.text: The calculator it's okay it works as it should. But it does feel cheap all the buttons on the calculator shift all over the place. It's annoying trying to get them to stay in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe

customer_reviews.title: pretty good for a cheap calculator, but has limits.
customer_reviews.text: it's not my old TI-93, but it was permitted on the EIT for my state license exam. The manual is necessary for some of the fancier features, I would not call it intuitive. One disappointment, I couldn't manipulate matrices higher than 3x3 - true if you enter everything in correctly it can prevent a stupid math error mistake on 3x3 and 2x2, but I can solve those as fast as I can enter them. If it could do 4x4s, that would be truly helpful. I guess it does more than I expected for a cheap little calculator (the price is amazing), but less than I'd hoped for a special purpose scientific calculator (what is advertised).
customer_reviews.author: ejw2010

customer_reviews.title: The Best Scientific Calculator On Earth!
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful scientific calculator. You cannot get other that has as much functionality at this price! This calculator is great for student at any level. It is also accepted in many test as well. If you are familiar with Casio Scientific calculator, you will be able to start using it immediately. If it is your first Casio scientific calculator, you will get used to it quickly, after a day or two. Casio has a good reputation in calculator market, for its functionality, price and beautiful design balance. So, just get it, and it is be best investment for your study.
customer_reviews.author: Tran Minh Triet

customer_reviews.title: ... allowed in my engineering (and chemistry) courses and I love it! It is so simple to use yet ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator since it was one of a few allowed in my engineering (and chemistry) courses and I love it! It is so simple to use yet does all the calculations you would ever need. I definetely recommend purchasing this one over the TI if you are a college student needing this for class and/or exams. PS it does 40 different conversions, check the back of the case! It is really handy when you need to convert temperatures in chemistry - all you have to do is push a few buttons and done (and you know it is correct). 10/10. Buy it, people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic calculator that does what it's supposed to do accurately
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked this calculator and the way it's set up since it was required for an algebra class I took in high school. It's not hard to figure out how to use any of the functions. The only reason I repurchased it was because I misplaced my original one from high school.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT SCIENTIFIC CALCULATOR!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Scientific Calculator for my son who is in college. He needed it for his chemistry class. He was extremely pleased with how easy it was to read and utilize. He really loved the textbook feature layout!! I have purchased other scientific calculators in the past; however, this one beats all of the other competitors hands down!!! The price is phenomenal as well. DR. COLE
customer_reviews.author: Dr. T

customer_reviews.title: perfect for electrical engineering majors
customer_reviews.text: for complex numbers in polar and rectangular form, this calculator is perfect. the price is right, the screen is bright, and the battery never dies. it has pre-programmed variables and can even do complex conjugates. perfect for engineering majors when you don't need a hefty graphing calculator or simply need the best complex numbers calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficul to use
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, this calculator behaves oddly in that if you add/subtract a list of items, it puts the answer as a division problem (not a decimal answer). Still sifting through the manual to see if there is a different mode.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Geppert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for FE and PE exams
customer_reviews.text: I had been using this calculator in college for a while and needed to replace mine because the keys were faded. This Casio calculator is the best for solving math and statistics problems. I used it for the FE exam and will be using for the PE as well.
customer_reviews.author: Leilamar Mousseau

customer_reviews.title: Perfect calculator for the PE.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for PE exam. Easy to use, intuitive, and best of all, easy to read formulas and calcs. You'll be zooming through calcs and functions with this. Will allow you to devote all your brain power to the actual problem solving. And stores previous calcs, so you can re-use. This tool was invaluable in sitting for and passing PE.
customer_reviews.author: asm154

customer_reviews.title: Best scientific calculator available
customer_reviews.text: READ: Most common question about this calc is how to display results as decimal values. Push the [S⇔D] button! The features and usability of the FX-115 line of calculators in unmatched in the scientific calculator market. Until this model sees another upgrade from Casio it will remain the best scientific calculator for general school exam use, for middle school through college. Teachers/professors who only prohibit graphing calculators obviously don't know how much a skilled user can do with a calculator like this!
customer_reviews.author: Ben R

customer_reviews.title: Clunky buttons, use only for FE
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take the FE. Buttons are not smooth to press and default should not be fractions. Takes a while to find pi and had to YouTube videos to get it to stop putting numbers into fractions. Will only use for required test and then back to my casio
customer_reviews.author: A Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Casio is the best calculator brand on the market(not talking about graphing)
customer_reviews.text: i used casio calculator for 5 years already, it is the easiest thing to find the functions you want, just look at the calculator! you will see the button you want in seconds. other calculator just made me waste time on my test to try to find the functions i want. Casio saved me time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Hard to learn great when you do
customer_reviews.text: I personally like this calculator just because it can do equations really well and I hardly had any work to show on paper, but it is hard to get acquainted to although when you do it works amazing
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: my son needed a scientific calculator for school and asked for this one. He loves it. Does a lot more than he even needed but he is glad that those options are there for him to use
customer_reviews.author: A.lopez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent calculator for the price! will get you on 90% of a regular student task day.
customer_reviews.text: Really good calculator for the price. If you don't want to spent more money on a calculator this one is perfect for everything that youll need on a 90% regular day/study task day. Really easy to use to.
customer_reviews.author: MrPiggs

customer_reviews.title: Loving this calculator.
customer_reviews.text: It takes some getting used to if you previously used TI's or another, but has been well worth it. The wide screen makes it easy to see, and some of the functions it has work easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: Best handheld calculator I've found. Particularly like its ability to find prime factors of a number, and its ease to work with fractions. Great all around.
customer_reviews.author: Dana F. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This classic is timeless!
customer_reviews.text: Best general purpose calculator around. You enter equations just the way you see them, not with some cryptic entry system (HP). It is not programmable and does not graph, but I used mine through Calculus 2 in college with good results.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Good and cheap calculator
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is perfect for math and physic calculus in high school. The interface is advance have 5 lines and graphic symbols for math operators .
customer_reviews.author: Edmundo Zacarias

customer_reviews.title: scientific calculator
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for grandson to use in school so personally I don't know about using it. After he receives it I'll ask him how good it works for him.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Superb Calculator If You Don't Need A Graphical One
customer_reviews.text: This is a great calculator with a lot of functions. You can solve quadratic, cubic and bi-quadratic functions on it. This is not a graphing calculator so it won't give you a graph plot but you can pretty much do everything with it that is related to Calculus and beyond. The display is wider and the best part is that you can get your answers in fractions (as well as converted decimal), and in standard scientific notation. You can also change base-n, like from Binary to Decimal, Octal & Hexadecimal and vice versa. There are more features but these are what I have been using it mostly for.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie

customer_reviews.title: Best FE/PE/SE Calculator
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this is the best calculator that you're able to use on the FE/PE/SE exams. It has battery plus solar so the battery shouldn't die for a very long time. It doesn't "tap" the desk as much as some of the other scientific calculators. I would recommend buying 2 of the exact same calculator. You definitely want a backup for the exam, and it would be really annoying to have a different backup calculator in the event that you had to use it. These exams are stressful enough to try using a different calculator than the one that you've been using while studying. So buy 2 of them, they're cheap enough that it isn't a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: The Nerdy Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month
customer_reviews.text: The calculator stopped working after a month and now i will have to buy a new one. Should have gone with the TI ones, at least they lasted more than one month!
customer_reviews.author: Ayush Upadhyay

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite scientific calculator. I own all of the offerings from TI, HP, Sharp, and Canon, and this one beats them all. Like it for its buttons and vast array of functions. If you like a very simple user interface, I would say go for the Sharp EL-W516 because this calculator can take a while to figure out. Many of the functions are hidden behind a lot of keypresses. But if you are the type that really likes to figure something out and use all the features, then go for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Calculator
customer_reviews.text: Nice calculator. I am using it for several month and I had no major problems with it. Just, the gide book is not complete and you have to search on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Nabt

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this calculator, I'm taking intermediate algebra since its been a while since high school. This is so helpful and very easy to use! I also bought an expensive graphing calculator that you can download programs to, but I end up using this one for all my tests. If you change the mode on this, there are very helpful programs (EQN and INEQ) that let me check that my work is correct. Highly recommend this and you can't beat the price! :)
customer_reviews.author: L. Thompson

product_meta.title: Casio FX115ESPLUS Scientific Calculator
product_meta.description: Advanced scientific calculator features Natural Textbook Display technology to show your mathematical expressions exactly as they appear in the textbook. Protective hard case keeps the calculator from being damaged while traveling. Calculator is powered by solar power and features a battery backup supply. Calculator is designed to be the perfect choice for students learning trigonometry, statistics, Algebra I and II, calculus, engineering, physics and more.
feature_bullets: Perfect choice for high school and college students
Natural Textbook Display is highly visible
Protective hard case keeps calculator from being damaged
Powered by solar power and features battery backup supply for reliable use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,753 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
